meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The old crow cackled in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The witch cackled as she stirred her cauldron.
meanings.sent3: The naughty parrot cackled loudly, mimicking the sound of a car alarm.
meanings.sent4: The wind cackled through the cracks in the window, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The rusty gate cackled in protest as it swung open.

meanings.definition: To laugh in a loud, shrill manner
meanings.sent1: The hyena cackled at the funny joke.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends cackled together at the comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child cackled with glee after pulling a prank on his sister.
meanings.sent4: The evil villain cackled menacingly as his plan unfolded.
meanings.sent5: The wicked witch cackled with delight as she cast her spell.
